history.content: @5897 and @5830 have similar issues. Seems like a glitch in Calcentral. Best advice is to either completely reenroll in the class or email sishelp@berkeley.edu.
@5897 and @5830 have similar issues. Best advice is to either completely reenroll in the class or email sishelp@berkeley.edu.

Dear Colleagues,

There is currently an issue where students are dropped from their discussion or lab, if they perform a discussion or lab change in a 3 component class set up. The issue occurs if the class is set up in the following format:
Lecture - enrollment component
Discussion and lab - non enrollment component
If the class is set up with lecture, discussion, and lab, the issue will occur if the student attempts to swap out either the discussion or the lab (only one).
Common classes which students experience the issue:
  • ELENG 16A and B
  • COMPSCI 16 B and C
  • ENGIN 7A
Example:
Enrolled in Lecture 001
Enrolled in Discussion 101
Enrolled in Lab 201
If the student attempts to swap discussion 101 to 102 (lecture and lab is not swapped), the error occurs and student is dropped from the discussion completely (currently enrolled discussion is dropped and newly requested discussion is not added). Student will then only be enrolled in a lecture and lab (incorrectly).
If the student swaps both discussion and lab, the error will not occur.
The issue is being reviewed for a permanent solution.

Best Regards,

Ricky To
Registration, Enrollment, and Fees Analyst
University of California, Berkeley
Office of the Registrar
119 Sproul Hall
Berkeley, CA 94720-5404
510-643-4294
http://registrar.berkeley.edu/registration

Hi all,

  

    I was enrolled in a lab section for EE 16A, but then I decided to switch lab sections. The result puzzled me; it caused me to not be enrolled in a lab section at all. So now I'm still enrolled in the course but I don't have a lab section. Is this okay? Any help would be appreciated.
history.subject: EE 16A Not enrolled in the lab
